title: CS40008: Parallel Algorithms - Quick Facts
text:
CS40008
Course name | Parallel Algorithms
Offered by | Computer Science & Engineering
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Spring

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Parallel Models (SIMD, MIMD, PRAMs, Interconnection Networks); Performance Measures (Time, Processors, Space, Work); Interconnection Architectures (Linear Array, Meshes, Trees, Mesh of Trees, Hypercubes, Butterfly Networks, Cube Connected Cycles, Benes Networks); Techniques (Balanced Trees, Pointer Jumping, Divide and Conquer, Partitioning, Pipelining, Systolic Computation, Accelerated Cascading, Prefix Computation, List Ranking, Euler Tour, Tree Contraction); Sorting, Searching, Merging; Matrix Operations; Graph Algorithms (Connected Components, Spanning Trees, Shortest Paths); Complexity (Lower bounds, NC Class and P-Completeness).
